intro: Anchusa cretica, commonly known as Cretan blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Anchusa cretica has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
